name: Nri.Ui.Outline.V1

aliases.name: NodeConfig
aliases.comment: Defines how a node should look.
aliases.type: { label : Html.Html msg , contents : Html.Html msg , children : List (Nri.Ui.Outline.V1.NodeLayout msg) , selected : Bool , ghosted : Bool , attrs : List (Html.Attribute msg) }

types.name: NodeLayout
types.comment:
A wrapper for a node rendered into Html. This type exists to prevent us
from accidentally wrapping a node in a container element before passing it as a
child to another node or segment. Such wrapping would break some of our
styling, which assumes nodes of the same level are sibblings in the Html tree.

values.name: config
values.comment:
A default node configuration, allowing you to only set the properties you care about.

    node { config | label = "Claim" }

values.name: html
node
segment

name: Nri.Ui.Checkbox.V2

aliases.name: Model
aliases.comment:
- isChecked : Maybe Bool
      - Just True == Checked (rendered checkmark)
      - Just False == Not Checked (rendered blank)
      - Nothing == Indeterminate (rendered dash)
aliases.type: { identifier : String , label : String , setterMsg : Bool -> msg , isChecked : Maybe.Maybe Bool , disabled : Bool , theme : Nri.Ui.Checkbox.V2.Theme , noOpMsg : msg }

aliases.name: PremiumConfig
aliases.comment:
- `onChange`: A message for when the user toggles the checkbox
  - `onLockedClick`: A message for when the user clicks a checkbox they don't have PremiumLevel for.
    If you get this message, you should show an `Nri.Ui.Premium.Model.view`
aliases.type: { label : String , id : String , selected : Nri.Ui.Checkbox.V2.IsSelected , disabled : Bool , teacherPremiumLevel : Nri.Ui.Data.PremiumLevel.PremiumLevel , contentPremiumLevel : Nri.Ui.Data.PremiumLevel.PremiumLevel , showFlagWhenLocked : Bool , onChange : Bool -> msg , onLockedClick : msg , noOpMsg : msg }

values.name: premium
values.comment:
A checkbox that should be used for premium content

This checkbox is locked when the premium level of the content is greater than the premium level of the teacher

values.name: view
values.comment: Shows a checkbox (the label is only used for accessibility hints)

values.name: viewWithLabel
values.comment: Shows a checkbox and its label text

name: Nri.Ui.Effects.V1
comment:
Css mixins reused across Nri modules.

@docs selectionShadow

values.name: selectionShadow
values.comment:
Draw a 2 px thick ochre border around the element to indicate it is
selected.

This uses a CSS box shadow to draw what looks like a border. Box shadows are
perfect for this because they don't affect the elements positioning in any way.
This means we can be sure switching the selection shadow on and off is not
going to make the element jump.

name: Nri.Ui.Palette.V1

aliases.name: Palette

name: Nri.Ui.Button.V1

aliases.name: ButtonContent
aliases.comment:
ButtonContent, often changes based on ButtonState.
For example, a button in the "Success" state
may have a different label than a button in the "Error" state
aliases.type: { label : String, state : Nri.Ui.Button.V1.ButtonState }

types.name: ButtonSize
types.comment:
Sizes for buttons that have button classes

NOTE: if you add a size here, you need to add Css styles using the sizeStyle helper in the styles definition.

types.name: ButtonState
types.comment:
Describes the state of a button. Has consequences for appearance and disabled attribute.

  - Enabled: An enabled button. Takes the appearance of ButtonStyle
  - Unfulfilled: A button which appears with the InactiveColors palette but is not disabled.
  - Disabled: A button which appears with the InactiveColors palette and is disabled.
  - Error: A button which appears with the ErrorColors palette and is not disabled.
  - Loading: A button which appears with the LoadingColors palette and is disabled
  - Success: A button which appears with the InactiveColors palette and is disabled

types.name: ButtonStyle
types.comment:
Styleguide-approved styles for your buttons!

Note on borderless buttons:
A borderless button that performs an action on the current page
This button is intended to look like a link.
Only use a borderless button when the clickable text in question follows the same layout/margin/padding as a bordered button

values.name: button
values.comment:
A delightful button which can trigger an effect when clicked!

This button will trigger the passed-in message if the button state is:

  - Enabled
  - Unfulfilled

This button will be Disabled if the button state is:

  - Disabled
  - Error
  - Loading
  - Success

name: Nri.Ui.BannerAlert.V1

values.name: error
values.comment: A banner to show error alerts

values.name: neutral
values.comment: A banner to show neutral alerts

name: Nri.Ui.Modal.V1

aliases.name: Model
aliases.comment:
- `onDismiss`: If `Nothing`, the modal will not be dismissable
  - `visibleTitle`: If `False`, the title will still be used for screen readers
  - `content`: This will be placed in a `width:100%` div in the main area of the modal
  - `footerContent`: The optional items here will be stacked below the main content area and center-aligned.
    Commonly you will either give a list of Nri.Ui.Buttons,
    or an empty list.
aliases.type: { title : String , visibleTitle : Bool , content : Html.Html msg , footerContent : List (Html.Html msg) , onDismiss : Maybe.Maybe msg , width : Maybe.Maybe Int }

aliases.name: Styles
aliases.comment:
- `css`: The resulting stylesheets to add to `Nri.Ui.Css.Site`
  - `id`, `class`, `classList`: The Html.Attribute helper functions
aliases.type: Nri.Ui.Styles.V1.StylesWithAssets id class msg ()

aliases.name: StylesWithAssets
aliases.comment:
Styles that depend on assets, for instance because they use a background
image somewhere.
aliases.type: { css : assets -> List DEPRECATED.Css.File.Stylesheet , id : id -> Html.Attribute msg , class : List class -> Html.Attribute msg , classList : List ( class, Bool ) -> Html.Attribute msg , div : class -> List (Html.Html msg) -> Html.Html msg , span : class -> List (Html.Html msg) -> Html.Html msg }

types.name: Keyframe
types.comment: A CSS keyframe animation that will have vendor prefixes automatically added.

values.name: keyframes
values.comment: Create a CSS keyframe animation with appropriate vendor prefixes

values.name: styles
values.comment:
Use this instead of Html.CssHelpers.
This will help you make sure you don't mismatch the namespace you're using.

    { css, class } =
        Nri.Ui.Styles.styles "Nri-Ui-MyWidget-"
            [ Css.Foreign.class Container
                [ backgroundColor Nri.Ui.Colors.V1.ochre ]
            ]
values.type: String -> List Css.Foreign.Snippet -> Nri.Ui.Styles.V1.Styles id class msg

values.name: stylesWithAssets
values.comment: Use this if your styles depend on asset files
values.type: String -> (assets -> List Css.Foreign.Snippet) -> Nri.Ui.Styles.V1.StylesWithAssets id class msg assets

values.name: stylesWithExtraStylesheets
values.comment:
Use this instead of [`styles`](#styles) if you need to
include Stylesheets from external packages,
or if you need to add styles without a namespace.
Remember, all stylesheets given here will be included
on all pages of the site.
values.type: String -> List DEPRECATED.Css.File.Stylesheet -> List Css.Foreign.Snippet -> Nri.Ui.Styles.V1.Styles id class msg

values.name: toString
values.comment: Turn a [`Keyframe`](#Keyframe) into a string that can be included in a CSS stylesheet.

name: Nri.Ui
comment:
A collection of helpers for working with NoRedInk projects

@docs styled

values.name: styled
values.comment:
Wrapper around [`Html.Styled.style`](http://package.elm-lang.org/packages/rtfeldman/elm-css/13.1.1/Html-Styled#styled) which adds a data-nri-description attribute to make it easier to tell from Inspect Element where in our code that element was defined.

Takes a function that creates an element, and pre-applies styles and a `data-nri-description` attribution to it.

    bigButton : List (Attribute msg) -> List (Html msg) -> Html msg
    bigButton =
        styled button
            "big button"
            [ padding (px 30)
            , fontWeight bold
            ]

    view : Model -> Html msg
    view model =
        [ text "These two buttons are identical:"
        , bigButton [] [ text "Hi!" ]
        , button [ css [ padding (px 30), fontWeight bold ] ] [] [ text "Hi!" ]
        ]

Here, the bigButton function we've defined using styled button is identical to the normal button function, except that it has pre-applied the attribute of css [ padding (px 30), fontWeight bold ], as well as `(attribute "data-nri-description" "big button")`.

You can pass more attributes to bigButton as usual (including other css attributes). They will be applied after the pre-applied styles.
values.type: (List (Html.Styled.Attribute msg) -> List (Html.Styled.Html msg) -> Html.Styled.Html msg) -> String -> List Css.Style -> List (Html.Styled.Attribute msg) -> List (Html.Styled.Html msg) -> Html.Styled.Html msg

name: Nri.Ui.AssetPath
comment:
Helpers for dealing with assets.

@docs Asset, url

name: Nri.Ui.Colors.Extra

values.name: toCoreColor
values.comment:
Convert a Css.Color into a Color.Color
toCoreColor (Css.hex "#FFFFFF") -- "RGBA 255 255 255 1 : Color.Color"

values.name: withAlpha
values.comment:
Add an alpha property to a Css.Color
grassland -- "{ value = "#56bf74", color = Compatible, red = 86, green = 191, blue = 116, alpha = 1, warnings = [] } : Css.Color"
withAlpha 0.5 grassland -- "{ value = "rgba(86, 191, 116, 0.5)", color = Compatible, warnings = [], red = 86, green = 191, blue = 116, alpha = 0.5 } : Css.Color"
